original: Åkerberg, Edvard Johan Folke, överläkare. Alingsås, f. 7/8/93 i Vanstad, Malmöh. 1., av kyrkoh. Lorens Å. o. Martha Sjöbohm’. G. 20 m. farm. kand. Elsa Hallberg, d. 45. Barn: Stig .f. 24, med. kand., Monica 31. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 13’, med. (kand. i Lund 17, med. lic. i Sthlm 24. Utb. i kir. v. ol. sjukh. i Sthlm o. Gbg 24-33’, bitr. öv iliäk. v. Örebro las. kir. avd. 33-40, överläk. o. styresman v. las. i Alingsås fr. 40. Skr.: div. upps. i kir. discipliner, spec. in. ur in v äg skir.
translated: Åkerberg, Edvard Johan Folke, senior physician. Born in Alingsås on August 7th, 1893, in Vanstad, Malmöhus County. First child of the reverend Lorens Å. and Martha Sjöbohm. Married on June 20th, 19xx, to Elsa Hallberg, a pharmaceutical student, who passed away in 1945. They had two children: Stig, born in 1924, a medical student, and Monica, born in 1931. Completed the matriculation examination in Malmö in 1913, graduated with a Bachelor of Medicine from Lund University in 1917, obtained a medical license in Stockholm in 1924. Received further training in surgery at hospitals in Stockholm and Gothenburg from 1924 to 1933, served as assistant senior physician at the surgical department of Örebro County Hospital from 1933 to 1940, and has been a senior physician and director of the county hospital in Alingsås since 1940. Has written various papers in surgical disciplines, specializing in urological surgery.

structured.name: Edvard Johan Folke Åkerberg
structured.description: Edvard Johan Folke Åkerberg, born on August 7th, 1893, in Vanstad, Malmöhus County, was a senior physician. He was the first child of Lorens Åkerberg, a reverend, and Martha Sjöbohm. Edvard married Elsa Hallberg, a pharmaceutical student, on June 20th, 19xx. They had two children, Stig and Monica. Stig, born in 1924, was a medical student. Edvard completed his matriculation examination in Malmö in 1913, graduated with a Bachelor of Medicine from Lund University in 1917, and obtained his medical license in Stockholm in 1924. He received further training in surgery at hospitals in Stockholm and Gothenburg from 1924 to 1933. He served as assistant senior physician at the surgical department of Örebro County Hospital from 1933 to 1940, and since 1940, he has been a senior physician and director of the county hospital in Alingsås. Edvard has written various papers in surgical disciplines, specializing in urological surgery.
